treatment.reference: Methanobacterium thermoalcaliphilum spec. nov. a new moderately alkaliphilic and thermophilic autotrophic methanogen Arch Microbiol 142:211-217
treatment.description: Morphology: Gram-negative, nonmotile, straight rods. Size 0.3 µm diameter by 3-4 µm long. Cells occur singly or in chains. Insensitive to antibiotics inhibiting peptidoglycan synthesis (penicillin, ampicillin and vancomycin). Colony characteristics: Circular, pale yellow in colour with entire edges. Temperature relationship: Optimum, 58-62˚C range: 40-69˚C. pH relationship: Optimum, 7.5- 8.5; range: 6,5 - 10.0. DNA base composition: 38.8 mol% G + C. Physiology: Obligately anaerobic; only H2 + CO2 serve as substrates for growth and methanogenesis. No growth occurred with methanol, formate, acetate or methylamines. Yeast extract was necessary for growth. Nutrition: Growth autotrophically in defined mineral medium and H2 + CO2 with the addition of yeast extract; elevated NaCl not required. Nickel stimulates growth. Source: Biogas digestor of cattle manure. Type strain: AC60 has been deposited in the German culture collection (DSM), Gottingen, FRG, number 3267.
